txt.en:
'The Orcs' ability to wage a large-scale war has been hindered, but only temporarily. More must be done to cripple their offensive capabilities.

'We must strike against the leadership. If there are none to command the siege-weapons, they are nothing but a pile of timber awaiting a flame. If the commander is defeated, the camp is no threat.

'Nûst commands Drû-garmadh. Head back south-east and defeat him and end this threat.'

'The head has been chopped off, and the snake lies limp. With Nûst defeated the camp is in disarray. I do not feel they will be making a coordinated attack at any time in the future. Thank you for your help.'
'Defeat Nûst, and the siege-weapons are but piles of wood.'
'The Orcs will have a terrible time rebuilding their war-presence in the Dale!'
The dwarves believe if they defeat the leader of Drû-garmadh, the threat will be defeated as well.
Nûst is at Drû-garmadh to the south-east.\n\nAlrekur believes if Nûst, Drû-garmadh's leader, is defeated, the camp will no longer provide a threat.
Alrekur is at Mekhem-bizru, north-west of Drû-garmadh.\n\nAlrekur will be pleased to hear Nûst has been defeated.
